thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL: Thursday Pickorama | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura
title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL: Thursday Pickorama | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
We're stuck in a holding, one which sees bouncing between seven and eight wins.
 Last week, we checked in with a sub-par 7-3 record. We experienced what is commonly referred to a bad beatdown in North Andover as Billerica steamrolled the Scarlet Knights to remain unbeaten.
 History did not repeat itself in Wellesley as the Red Raiders snapped a 15-game losing streak to Walpole with a 7-6 victory, giving us our second loss. The final setback occurred at Endicott College where Marblehead kept us from an eight-win week by rallying to defeat Salem.
 On to Week 6 of the Thursday Pickorama .
 MILLIS-HOPEDALE over Ashland: Mohawks have played the tougher schedule and it will pay dividends here.
 Billerica over HAVERHILL: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. Billerica gets the call here.
 Central Catholic over ANDOVER: Raiders prevail in a battle of former Thanksgiving Day sparring partners.
 EAST BRIDGEWATER over Dighton-Rehoboth: Dave Driscoll has done another fantastic job at D-R, but this appears to be a tall order.
 St. John's Prep over BC HIGH: Eagles inching closer to the showdown with Xaverian.
 CARDINAL SPELLMAN over St. Mary's: Cardinals in the midst of a huge two-game slate with Bishop Fenwick to follow.
 NEWTON SOUTH over Westford Academy: A classic pick-em game.
 MILTON ACADEMY over BB&N: Pretty much a must-game for both teams to remain in consideration for a bowl berth.
 St. Sebastian's over LAWRENCE ACADEMY: Gallagher brothers lead the way.
 NANTUCKET over West Bridgewater: Whalers roll in a battle of unbeatens.
 LAST WEEK: 7-3 (.700)
 SEASON TO DATE: 38-12 (.500)
